subject: Re: [junit] running individual testcases in JUnit 4.0
msgSnippet: Rajesh, In short, there s not an easy way, but there is a hard way, using the Filter interface.  I ll try to get more details in a day or two, unless someone
messageBody:
Rajesh,

In short, there's not an easy way, but there is a hard way, using the Filter
interface. I'll try to get more details in a day or two, unless someone
beats me to the punch.

David Saff

On Wed, Dec 17, 2008 at 6:52 AM, rajesh gotapu <rajesh_g1231@...>wrote:

> Hi,
> I need to run individual TestCases in JUnit4
> I could only find the below code in google which run with prior
> versions of JUnit 4.0 i.e., non annotations JUnit TestCases.
>
>
> package suite;
> import junit.framework.*;
> import com.Semantic.Sampletesting;
> public class Sampletestforinstaller extends TestSuite{
> public static void main (String[] args) {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> }
> public static Test suite ( ) {
> TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(new com.Arsindemo2.Sampletesting("testfail"));
> suite.addTest(new com.Arsindemo2.Sampletesting("testpass"));
> return suite;
> }
> }
>
> I above is not working with JUnit4.
>
> I want the same above equivalent code in JUnit4 of below format.
> package suite;
> import junit.framework.*;
> import org.junit.runners.*;
> import org.junit.runner.*;
> import com.SubscriptionTest;
> @RunWith(value=Suite.class)
> @...(value={SubscriptionTest.class})
>
> public class TSJUnit4
> {
> }
> please reply to me.
>
> I would be very thankful to you.
>
> I is very urgent for me.
>
> Thanks in advance,
> Rajesh Gottapu
>

>
